Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: சொற்கோட்டம் இல்லது செப்பம் ஒருதலையாஉட்கோட்டம் இன்மை பெறின்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Freedom from obliquity of speech is rectitude, if there be (corresponding) freedom from bias of mind.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is speaking. Their words ('சொல்') are visualized as perfectly straight, crystalline arrows flying true to their mark.
Layered_Composition.Midground: A transparent view into the person's mind ('உள்') reveals the source: their heart and mind are perfectly aligned, a straight, unwavering column of pure light, with no crookedness or bias ('உட்கோட்டம் இன்மை').
Layered_Composition.Background: The straight words and the straight mind are shown as two parts of a single, unified phenomenon, which is defined as Rectitude ('செப்பம்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: True rectitude is when unbiased speech is born from an unbiased mind. The straightness of the word is only possible if the thought behind it is also straight.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The concept of 'Kottam' (crookedness) vs. 'Seppam' (straightness/rectitude) is visualized literally. The straightness of the mind-column directly causes the straightness of the word-arrows. If the mind-column were bent, the arrows would also fly crooked.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A pure, clear, white light illuminates the scene, originating from the column of the unbiased mind. The crystalline word-arrows refract this light beautifully.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A profile shot that allows for a clear view of the person, the internal state of their mind, and the external path of their words.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, with advanced light and transparency effects.

Flux_Optimized_Prompt.Negative_Prompt: crooked arrows, bent mind-column, text artifacts, dark light.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore the visual of 'straight words' as crystalline arrows.
